title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: Install the game on my Windows PC
priority: I want to run a simple
dependencies: so that I can get the game set up on my computer quickly and without errors
acceptance_criteria_1: and start playing right away.
acceptance_criteria_2: Must Have
definition_of_done: Given I have downloaded the standalone installer executable for Monopoly Tycoon on a Windows PC with sufficient disk space and administrative rights, when I run the installer and accept all default options by clicking 'Next' through the wizard, accept the EULA, and click 'Install', then The installer copies all game files to the default program files directory, a progress bar is shown, and a completion screen appears.
column14: Given I have started the installer on a machine where the target drive has less than the required 2 GB of free space, when I click the 'Install' button on the final confirmation step, then the installer must display a user-friendly error message stating that there is insufficient disk space and specifying the required amount.
column15: Given I am logged into a standard Windows user account without administrative privileges, when I run the installer executable, then the Windows User Account Control (UAC) prompt must appear, requesting elevation to administrative privileges.
column16: WI-801-001: Develop Inno Setup Installer Script
column17: All acceptance criteria met. Installer is a single, digitally signed executable. Manual E2E testing on Windows 10 & 11 is complete. Uninstaller is correctly registered.

title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: Choose a custom installation directory
description: As a Windows PC user installing the game
priority: I want to be able to choose a custom installation directory so that I can manage my disk space and organize my installed applications according to my personal preferences.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user is running the game installer and has reached the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user clicks the 'Browse...' button, selects a valid directory on a different drive (e.g., 'D:\\Games'), and proceeds with the installation, then the installer successfully installs all game files into the 'D:\\Games\\MonopolyTycoon' directory.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user views the screen or selects a different drive, then the UI accurately displays the total disk space required for the game and the available disk space on the currently selected drive, updating dynamically when the drive is changed.
technical_tasks: Given the user is on the 'Choose Install Location' screen, when the user selects a directory on a drive where the available space is less than the required space, then the installer displays a clear error message stating 'Insufficient disk space' and the 'Install' button is disabled.
definition_of_done: WI-801-001: Develop Inno Setup Installer Script
column14: All acceptance criteria met. Installer script is updated and peer-reviewed. Manual testing confirms custom path installation and disk space validation work correctly.

title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: Provide an option to create a desktop shortcut during installation
description: As a new player installing the game
priority: I want to see a checkbox option to create a desktop shortcut during the installation process
story_points: so that I can easily find and launch the game directly from my desktop after it's installed.
dependencies: Should Have
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is running the game installer, when the user navigates to the 'Select Additional Tasks' screen and sees the 'Create a desktop shortcut' option is checked by default, and they proceed with the installation, then a shortcut named 'Monopoly Tycoon' is created on the user's desktop.
technical_tasks: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, when the user inspects the shortcut's properties, then the shortcut displays the official game icon and its target path correctly points to the game's primary executable in the chosen installation directory.
definition_of_done: Given a desktop shortcut was created via the installer, when the user double-clicks the desktop shortcut, then the Monopoly Tycoon game application launches successfully.
column14: WI-801-001: Develop Inno Setup Installer Script
column15: All acceptance criteria met. Installer script is updated and peer-reviewed. Manual testing confirms shortcut is created, functional, and optional.

title: Ensure UI and Game View Adapt to Different Monitor Aspect Ratios
user_role: As a PC gamer with a monitor of any common aspect ratio, I want the game's user interface and 3D view to automatically adapt to my screen's dimensions so that I can play the game without any visual distortion, overlapping elements, or loss of critical information.
dependencies: Given the game is launched in fullscreen mode on a display with a 16:9 aspect ratio (e.g., 1920x1080), when the user navigates to the main gameplay screen, then the game board is fully visible and centered, and all HUD elements are positioned correctly in their designated corners without overlapping.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is launched in fullscreen mode on a display with a 21:9 aspect ratio (e.g., 2560x1080), when the user views the main gameplay screen, then the game board maintains its correct proportions, HUD elements are anchored correctly, and modal dialogs appear centered and are not horizontally stretched.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is running in windowed mode, when the user clicks and drags the window border to change its size and aspect ratio, then the UI layout and game view dynamically update to fit the new dimensions upon releasing the mouse button without errors.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-501-001: Implement 3D Game Board and Camera
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met for 16:9, 16:10, and 21:9 aspect ratios. Manual E2E testing confirms no visual regressions on supported resolutions. UI layout is reviewed and approved.

title: Receive guidance on locating log files after an error
user_role: As a player who has encountered an unexpected game crash, I want to be shown a clear error message that includes a unique error ID and instructions on where to find the log files, so that I can easily provide developers with the necessary information to diagnose and fix the bug.
dependencies: Given the game is running and an unhandled exception occurs in the application's code, when the global exception handler catches the exception, then a modal error dialog is displayed, blocking interaction with the game window.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the error dialog is displayed, when the user views the dialog content, then the dialog contains a non-technical message, a unique Error ID, and the full, absolute path to the user's log directory.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an unhandled exception has been caught and an Error ID is displayed to the user, when the exception is processed by the logging system, then a log entry at the 'ERROR' level is written to the log file, containing the full exception details and the exact same Error ID shown in the dialog.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-102-001: Implement Global Unhandled Exception Handler; WI-102-002: Create Modal Error Dialog UI
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Global exception handler is registered and functional. Error dialog UI is implemented and approved. Manual testing confirms the end-to-end flow from crash to log file verification.

title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: Uninstall the game cleanly from my computer
description: As a Windows PC user who no longer wishes to keep the game installed
priority: I want a standard and thorough uninstallation process so that I can completely remove all application files and reclaim my disk space
dependencies: Must Have
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the game is successfully installed on a Windows machine, when the user navigates to 'Apps & features', selects 'Monopoly Tycoon', and clicks 'Uninstall', then the uninstallation wizard is launched, and the game's entry is removed from the list upon completion.
technical_tasks: Given the user has initiated the uninstallation process and confirmed they wish to proceed, when the uninstaller completes successfully, then the main installation directory and all its contents are deleted, the desktop shortcut is removed, and the Start Menu folder/shortcut is removed.
definition_of_done: Given the Monopoly Tycoon game application is currently running, when the user attempts to launch the uninstaller, then the uninstaller displays a clear error message stating the game must be closed before proceeding and will not continue until the application is terminated.
column15: All acceptance criteria met. Uninstaller script is peer-reviewed. Manual testing confirms complete removal of application files and correct handling of running processes.

title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: Choose to keep my personal data upon uninstallation
description: As a Windows PC Gamer who needs to uninstall the game, I want to be given a clear choice to keep or delete my personal game data (like save files and player profile) so that I can reinstall the game later without losing all my progress and achievements.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data located in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'No' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files and shortcuts are completely removed, but the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents remain untouched.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the game is installed and the user has created personal data located in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory, when the user runs the uninstaller and selects 'Yes' at the prompt asking to remove personal data, then the application files and shortcuts are completely removed, AND the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon' directory and all its contents are also deleted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the user is uninstalling the game and personal data exists, when the uninstaller displays the prompt for data removal, then the dialog text explicitly mentions 'save games, player profiles, and statistics', and the default selected button is 'No' (to keep data).
technical_tasks: WI-801-002: Implement Uninstaller Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Uninstaller script logic is peer-reviewed. Manual E2E testing of all scenarios (keep, delete, no data) is completed and passed.

title: Start a new game from the main menu
user_role: As a player, I want to select a 'New Game' option from the main menu so that I can proceed to the game setup screen and configure a new match.
dependencies: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen, and the main menu screen is no longer visible or interactive.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player uses keyboard navigation to focus on the 'New Game' button and presses the activation key, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player is on the main menu screen, when the player clicks the 'New Game' button multiple times in quick succession, then the application transitions to the Game Setup screen only once, without errors or unexpected behavior.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-001: Create Game Setup Screen
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Main menu button correctly transitions to the game setup scene. Transition is performant and handles repeated inputs gracefully.

title: Configure a game with one to three AI opponents
user_role: As a player setting up a new game, I want to select the number of AI opponents from a choice of one, two, or three, so that I can customize the game's challenge, duration, and overall experience to my preference.
dependencies: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I select '3' as the number of AI opponents and start the game, then a new game session is created with a total of four players: one human and three AIs.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I navigate to the game setup screen for the first time, when the screen finishes loading, then a default value (e.g., '2' AI opponents) is pre-selected in the UI.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the game setup screen, when I change the selected number of AI opponents from '1' to '3', then the UI dynamically updates to display configuration sections for three distinct AI opponents.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-001: Create Game Setup Screen
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. UI control is implemented and approved. Integration testing confirms selection correctly influences player count at game start.

title: Set a unique difficulty level for each AI opponent
user_role: As a Human Player setting up a new game, I want to independently assign a difficulty level (Easy, Medium, or Hard) to each of my AI opponents so that I can customize the game's challenge to match my skill level and desired experience.
dependencies: Given I am on the Game Setup screen and have selected 3 AI opponents, when I set the difficulty for 'AI 1' to 'Easy', 'AI 2' to 'Hard', and 'AI 3' to 'Medium', then the UI must clearly display 'Easy' for AI 1, 'Hard' for AI 2, and 'Medium' for AI 3 respectively.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the Game Setup screen, when I increase the number of AI opponents from 1 to 2, then a new UI section for 'AI 2' appears, and its difficulty selector defaults to 'Medium'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have configured a game with two AI opponents set to 'Easy' and 'Hard', when I start the game, then the internal PlayerState objects for the two AIs must be initialized with 'ai_difficulty' properties of 'Easy' and 'Hard' respectively.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-001: Create Game Setup Screen
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. UI controls for each AI slot are implemented. Integration testing confirms difficulties are correctly passed to the GameState on start.

title: Create a player profile with a custom name
user_role: As a new or returning player, I want to create a personal profile by entering a custom name, so that my game progress, historical statistics, and high scores are saved and displayed under my unique identity.
dependencies: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a valid name (e.g., 'BoardwalkKing') and proceeds with game setup, then a new player profile is created and persisted with the entered name and a unique internal profile_id.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters (e.g., 'Ty') and attempts to proceed, then a user-friendly validation message is displayed indicating the name is too short, and the game setup does not proceed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has successfully created a profile with the name 'CashMoney', when the game starts, then the human player's name is displayed as 'CashMoney' in the main game HUD.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-001: Create Game Setup Screen
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Input validation logic is implemented and unit tested. Integration with database persistence is successful. Name is correctly displayed in-game.

title: Receive feedback for an invalid profile name
user_role: As a player setting up my profile, I want to receive immediate and clear feedback if the name I enter is invalid, so that I can easily correct it and proceed to start the game without frustration.
dependencies: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name with fewer than 3 characters, then a specific error message 'Name must be at least 3 characters long' is displayed below the input field, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player enters a name containing special characters (e.g., 'Player!@#'), then a specific error message 'Name can only contain letters and numbers' is displayed, and the option to proceed is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has entered an invalid name and an error message is currently displayed, when the player edits the name so that it meets all validation criteria, then the error message disappears, and the option to proceed becomes enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-001: Create Game Setup Screen
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Real-time validation UI is implemented and approved. Unit tests for validation logic cover all rules and edge cases.

title: View my persistent historical gameplay statistics
user_role: As a returning player, I want to access a dedicated screen that displays my cumulative gameplay statistics from all my completed games, so that I can track my performance, see my win/loss record, and feel a sense of long-term progression and achievement.
dependencies: Given the player has completed at least one game, when the player selects the 'Player Statistics' option from the main menu, then a dedicated statistics screen is displayed showing correct values for all required metrics like Total Wins, Win/Loss Ratio, etc.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has created a profile but has not completed any games, when the player navigates to the 'Player Statistics' screen, then the screen displays all statistical categories with appropriate default values (e.g., 'Total Games Played: 0').
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has existing statistics, when the player completes and wins a new game and returns to the main menu, then the 'Total Games Played' and 'Total Wins' statistics are correctly incremented, and the 'Win/Loss Ratio' is recalculated.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-602-002: Implement Statistics Repository
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Statistics screen UI is implemented. End-to-end flow from game completion to database update is tested and verified.

title: Select my player token from a set of classic options
user_role: As a player setting up a new game, I want to choose my game piece from a visual selection of classic tokens, so that I can personalize my in-game identity and feel more connected to the game experience.
dependencies: Given the player is on the game setup screen, when the player clicks on an available token (e.g., 'Top Hat'), then the 'Top Hat' token becomes visually highlighted, and a preview is shown next to the player's name.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has selected a token and configured a game with 3 AI opponents, when the player starts the game, then the AI opponents are each assigned a unique token from the pool of tokens not selected by the human player.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player selected the 'Battleship' token during game setup, when the main game view loads, then the player's 3D game piece on the board and their icon in the HUD is the 'Battleship'.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-001: Create Game Setup Screen
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Token selection UI is implemented and approved. AI token assignment is verified to ensure uniqueness. Selected token is correctly displayed in-game.

title: Roll two six-sided dice to start my move
user_role: As a human player whose turn it is
description: I want to click a button to roll two virtual dice
priority: so that I can determine the number of spaces my token will move and proceed with my turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is the human player's turn and they are in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the system generates two random integer values, each between 1 and 6 inclusive, using a cryptographically secure method.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given it is an AI player's turn OR the human player is not in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the game state is updated, then the 'Roll Dice' button is visually disabled and non-interactive.
technical_tasks: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' setting to 'Instant', when the player clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the dice roll animation is skipped entirely, but the result is still calculated and displayed correctly before the token moves.
column14: All acceptance criteria met. Dice roll is integrated into the turn state machine. 'Roll Dice' button state is managed correctly. Dice roll animation is polished and respects game speed settings.

title: Watch my token automatically move around the board
user_role: As a player, I want to see my game token animate its movement from one space to the next after I roll the dice, so that I can visually track my progress around the board and have an immersive, intuitive gameplay experience.
dependencies: Given the player's token is on 'St. Charles Place' (index 11), when the player completes a dice roll with a total of 5, then the token animates moving sequentially across 5 spaces, landing on 'Indiana Avenue' (index 16), and the camera smoothly follows the token's movement.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Instant' in the settings menu, when the player's token needs to move, then the token instantly teleports to the destination space without a sequential movement animation, accompanied by a brief visual effect.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's turn results in them being sent to Jail, when the game logic directs the player to Jail, then the token does not animate space-by-space but instead plays a special, direct animation from its current space to the 'In Jail' section of the board.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-501-002: Implement Token Movement and Dice Animations
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Token movement is smooth and visually appealing. Camera follow is implemented. Special move cases (Jail) and game speed settings are handled correctly.

title: Receive an extra turn after rolling doubles
user_role: As a player (human or AI), I want to be granted an immediate, additional turn after I roll doubles, so that the game correctly follows the official Monopoly rules and provides an authentic gameplay experience.
dependencies: Given it is a player's turn and their consecutive doubles count is 0, when the player rolls doubles, then the player's token moves, the destination space action is completed, the game state confirms it is still the same player's turn, and their consecutive doubles count is incremented to 1.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has just completed a turn by rolling doubles, when the player rolls again and the result is not a double, then the player moves, their consecutive doubles count is reset to 0, and the turn passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, when the player rolls doubles to get out, then the player moves, completes their action, and their turn ends; they are NOT granted an extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-002: Implement Dice Rolling Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Doubles logic is integrated with the turn manager. Consecutive doubles are tracked. The 'get out of jail' exception is correctly implemented and tested.

title: Be sent to jail for rolling three consecutive doubles
user_role: As a player, I want the game to automatically send my token to jail if I roll three consecutive doubles in a single turn, so that the game correctly enforces the official rules.
dependencies: Given a player is taking their turn and has already rolled doubles twice in a row, when the player rolls the dice for a third time and the result is doubles, then the player's token is immediately moved directly to the 'In Jail' space, their turn ends, and play passes to the next player.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player has rolled doubles twice and is on a space near GO (e.g., Boardwalk), when the player rolls their third consecutive double, then the player's token is sent directly to Jail and does not collect the $200 GO salary.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI player is taking its turn and has already rolled doubles twice in a row, when the AI player's third roll is doubles, then the AI player is sent to jail, its turn ends, and a non-intrusive notification is displayed to the human player about the event.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-002: Implement Dice Rolling Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Logic for tracking and acting on the third double is implemented and tested. Go to Jail action correctly bypasses normal movement and GO salary.

title: Collect $200 salary when passing or landing on GO
user_role: As a Player, I want my cash balance to be automatically credited with a $200 salary for completing a lap of the board, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
dependencies: Given a player's token is on 'Boardwalk' (space 39) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 5, causing their token to move past GO and land on 'Baltic Avenue' (space 3), then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player's token is on 'Park Place' (space 37) with a cash balance of $500, when the player rolls a 3, causing their token to land exactly on 'GO' (space 0), then the player's cash balance is automatically increased to $700.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player's token is on a Chance space and they draw a card that reads 'Go to Jail', when the card action is executed, then the player's token is moved directly to the 'In Jail' location and their cash balance remains unchanged.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Salary collection logic is implemented and correctly handles both passing and landing on GO. Exceptions for 'Go to Jail' are correctly handled.

title: Get out of jail by paying the $50 fine
user_role: As a player who is in jail, I want to be presented with the option to pay a $50 fine at the beginning of my turn, so that I can immediately get out of jail and continue my turn normally.
dependencies: Given I am in the 'InJail' state and it is the start of my turn with a cash balance of $1500, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options and I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $1450, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed to the Pre-Roll Management phase of my turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of $49, when the game presents the 'Get Out of Jail' options, then the 'Pay $50 Fine' option is visually disabled and non-interactive.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the 'InJail' state with a cash balance of exactly $50, when I select the 'Pay $50 Fine' option, then my cash balance is reduced to $0, my player status is updated to 'Active', and I proceed with my turn.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Jail options UI is implemented. Payment logic is integrated with player state and turn manager. Insufficient funds case is handled correctly.

title: Get out of jail by using a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card
user_role: As a player who is in jail and owns a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, I want to be presented with the option to use it at the start of my turn, so that I can get out of jail immediately without spending money.
dependencies: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 1, when the player selects 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card', then the player's 'status' is updated to 'Active', their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 0, and they proceed to a normal turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player uses a 'Get Out of Jail Free' card that originated from the Chance deck, when the action to use the card is confirmed, then the specific card is placed at the bottom of the Chance card deck.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player's status is 'InJail' and their 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count is 0, when their turn begins and the jail options are presented, then the UI option to 'Use Get Out of Jail Free Card' is not displayed or is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Logic for using the card is implemented and tested. Card is correctly removed from player inventory and returned to the correct deck. UI option is conditional.

title: Attempt to get out of jail by rolling for doubles
user_role: As a player in jail, I want to choose the option to roll the dice on my turn, so that I can attempt to get out of jail for free by rolling doubles.
dependencies: Given I am in the Jail space with a status of 'InJail', when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and my roll is doubles, then my player status is updated to 'Active', my token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice, and my turn ends (no extra turn).
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the Jail space with a status of 'InJail', when I select the 'Roll for Doubles' option and my roll is not doubles, then my 'jail_turns_remaining' is decremented by 1 and my turn immediately ends.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the jail action menu is displayed with multiple options ('Roll for Doubles', 'Pay Fine'), when I click the 'Roll for Doubles' button, then all other options in the jail action menu become disabled and the dice roll sequence is initiated.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. All success, failure, and UI state change scenarios are implemented and tested. Special rule for no extra turn is explicitly verified.

title: Be forced to pay the fine after failing to roll doubles for 3 turns in jail
user_role: As a player in jail for my third consecutive turn, I want the game to automatically force me to pay the $50 fine if I fail to roll doubles, so that the official game rules are enforced and my turn can proceed correctly.
dependencies: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1 (indicating the 3rd turn), and they have more than $50 cash, when the player chooses to roll the dice and the result is not doubles, then the player's cash is reduced by $50, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves the number of spaces shown on the dice.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state and their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, when the player chooses to roll the dice and the result is doubles, then the player's cash is not changed, their status changes to 'Active', and their token moves, but they do not get an extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is in the 'InJail' state, their 'jail_turns_remaining' count is 1, and they have less than $50 cash, when the player rolls the dice and the result is not doubles, then the game flow is paused, and the player is prompted to raise funds to cover the $50 debt before their turn can proceed.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. All scenarios (sufficient funds, insufficient funds, doubles roll) are implemented and tested. Integration with bankruptcy system is verified.

title: Draw a Chance card when landing on a Chance space
user_role: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Chance card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Chance space, so that the game follows the official rules and introduces an element of luck.
dependencies: Given a player lands on a Chance space and the top card is 'Bank pays you dividend of $50', when the card is drawn, then a UI element displays the card, the player's cash balance is increased by $50, and the card is placed at the bottom of the Chance deck.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on a Chance space and draws the 'Get Out of Jail Free' card, when the card is drawn, then the card is displayed, the player's 'get_out_of_jail_cards' count becomes 1, and this specific card is removed from the deck cycle until used.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on a Chance space and draws the 'Go to Jail' card, when the card is drawn, then the card is displayed, the player's token moves directly to the 'In Jail' space, their status is set to 'InJail', and they do not collect $200 for passing Go.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-201-003: Implement Card Deck Management Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. All 16 standard Chance cards are implemented and tested. Card drawing, execution, and deck cycling logic is verified. Integration with Jail, Go, and Bankruptcy systems is complete.

title: Draw a Community Chest card when landing on a Community Chest space
user_role: As a player, I want the game to automatically draw a Community Chest card and execute its instructions when my token lands on a Community Chest space, so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
dependencies: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw a card instructing them to collect money (e.g., 'Bank error in your favor. Collect $200'), then the player's cash balance and the HUD is increased by the specified amount.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player lands on Community Chest, when they draw the 'Go to Jail' card, then the player's token is moved directly to the 'In Jail' section of the board and their turn ends immediately.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player lands on Community Chest and there are other active players, when they draw a card like 'It is your birthday. Collect $10 from every player', then the active player's cash balance increases by $10 for each opponent, and each opponent's cash balance decreases by $10.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-201-003: Implement Card Deck Management Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. All 16 standard Community Chest cards are implemented and tested. Card logic, including multi-player transactions, is verified. Integration with other systems is complete.

title: Choose to pay $200 or 10% of my net worth for Income Tax
user_role: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear choice between paying a flat $200 or 10% of my total net worth when I land on the Income Tax space, so that I can make the most strategic financial decision.
dependencies: Given the human player's token's movement ends on the 'Income Tax' space, when the movement phase concludes, then the game flow pauses and a modal dialog is displayed to the player with two choices.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has $500 cash and properties/buildings worth $1500 (Total Net Worth = $2000), when the Income Tax dialog is displayed, then the dialog must present two choices: one for a flat '$200' and another for '10% of Net Worth' which displays the calculated value of '$200'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has $100 cash and a total net worth of $1500, when the player selects either the '$200' or '$150' option, then the game initiates the asset liquidation flow, requiring the player to mortgage properties or sell buildings to cover the chosen debt.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Net worth calculation is accurate and unit tested. UI dialog is implemented and approved. Integration with bankruptcy/liquidation flow is verified.

title: Pay a fixed Luxury Tax amount
user_role: As a player
description: I want the game to automatically deduct the fixed Luxury Tax amount from my cash when I land on that space
priority: so that the game correctly follows the official rules.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has a cash balance greater than the Luxury Tax amount, when the player's token movement ends on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the fixed tax amount is deducted from the player's cash balance and a notification is displayed.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount but owns assets, when the player's token movement ends on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the game flow is paused, and the player is prompted to manage their assets to pay the debt.
technical_tasks: Given a player has a cash balance less than the Luxury Tax amount and cannot raise sufficient funds, when their token movement ends on the 'Luxury Tax' space, then the player is declared bankrupt to the Bank.
definition_of_done: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
column14: All acceptance criteria met. Tax deduction logic is implemented. Integration with asset liquidation and bankruptcy systems is complete and tested.

title: Experience no gameplay effect when landing on Free Parking
user_role: As a player, I want the game to apply no special action when my token lands on the Free Parking space so that the game adheres to the official Monopoly rules.
dependencies: Given a player is in an active turn and has not rolled doubles, when the player's token movement concludes on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged, no action prompt is displayed, and the game proceeds to the next player's turn.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in an active turn and rolls doubles, when the player's token movement concludes on the 'Free Parking' space, then the player's cash balance remains unchanged and the game prompts the player to take their extra turn.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player is on a space before GO with $500 cash, when the player rolls a number that causes them to pass GO and land on 'Free Parking', then the player's cash balance first increases by $200 for passing GO, resulting in a final balance of $700.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-003: Implement Core Board Space Actions
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Logic for Free Parking is implemented as a no-op. Interaction with doubles rule and Pass Go rule is verified.

title: Manage my properties before rolling the dice
user_role: As a strategic player, I want a dedicated phase at the start of my turn to manage my properties (build, mortgage, trade) before I roll the dice, so that I can proactively adjust my financial position.
dependencies: Given it is the start of the human player's turn and the player is not in jail, when the game transitions control to the human player, then the game enters a 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', the 'Roll Dice' button is enabled, and property management UI controls are enabled.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', when the player successfully builds a house and then clicks the 'Roll Dice' button, then the house is added, cash is deducted, property management controls become disabled, and the game proceeds to the 'Roll Phase'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has just completed a turn where they rolled doubles, when the game grants the player an extra turn, then the game returns to the 'Pre-Roll Management Phase', allowing the player to manage properties again before their next roll.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-202-001: Develop Turn Management State Machine
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. The turn state machine correctly implements the Pre-Roll phase, waiting for player input. Integration with management actions (build, trade, etc.) is verified.

title: Choose to buy an unowned property I land on
user_role: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear prompt when I land on an unowned property, giving me the option to purchase it, so that I can strategically acquire assets.
dependencies: Given I am the human player with $1000 in cash, when my token's movement ends on the unowned property 'St. Charles Place' (list price $140), then a modal dialog is displayed with options to 'Buy' or 'Auction'.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the property purchase dialog is displayed and I click the 'Buy' button, then my cash is reduced by $140, 'St. Charles Place' is added to my list of owned properties, and the board is visually updated to show my ownership.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am the human player with $100 in cash, when my token lands on the unowned 'St. Charles Place' (list price $140), then the property purchase dialog is displayed, but the 'Buy' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-301-001: Implement Property Purchase and Auction Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Purchase dialog UI is implemented and approved. Purchase transaction is atomic and correctly updates game state and visuals. Insufficient funds case is handled.

title: Choose to send an unowned property to auction instead of buying it
user_role: As a Human Player, I want the option to decline the immediate purchase of an unowned property I land on so that I can trigger an auction for that property.
dependencies: Given I am the human player and have landed on an unowned property, when the game presents me with a modal dialog to buy the property, then the dialog must display two distinct, enabled options: 'Buy' and 'Auction'.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the purchase decision dialog is displayed, when I click the 'Auction' button, then the purchase decision dialog closes immediately and the auction process begins, involving all active players.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have landed on an unowned property that I do not have sufficient cash to purchase, when the game presents me with the purchase decision dialog, then the 'Buy' button must be visually disabled, and the 'Auction' button must remain enabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-301-001: Implement Property Purchase and Auction Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. The 'Auction' button is present on the purchase dialog and correctly triggers the auction system. Button states for insufficient funds are correct.

title: Participate in an auction for a property
user_role: As a Human Player, I want to participate in a turn-based auction for an unowned property, placing bids against AI opponents, so that I have a strategic opportunity to acquire properties.
dependencies: Given an auction is in progress for 'Boardwalk', when the human player places a valid winning bid and all other players withdraw, then the auction UI closes, the final bid amount is deducted from the human player's cash, and 'Boardwalk' is added to their portfolio.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an auction is in progress and it is the human player's turn to bid, when the human player selects the 'Withdraw' or 'Pass' option, then the human player is marked as inactive for this auction, and the turn passes to the next player in the bidding order.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an auction is in progress, the current high bid is $200, and the human player has $205 cash, when it is the human player's turn and the minimum next bid is $206, then the 'Place Bid' button is disabled, leaving 'Withdraw' as the only available action.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-301-001: Implement Property Purchase and Auction Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Auction UI is implemented and approved. Bidding, winning, and withdrawing logic is fully functional. Insufficient funds case is handled correctly.

title: Build houses on properties in a complete color set
user_role: As a player who owns a complete color set, I want to purchase and build houses on those properties so that I can increase the rent value.
dependencies: Given I own all Light Blue properties, they are unmortgaged, I have over $50 cash, and the bank has houses, when I choose to build one house on Oriental Avenue, then my cash is reduced by $50, the bank's house count decreases by one, and a house appears on the Oriental Avenue space.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own Oriental Avenue and Vermont Avenue, but not Connecticut Avenue, when I access the property management screen, then the option to build houses on my Light Blue properties is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own the complete Light Blue monopoly but Oriental Avenue is mortgaged, when I attempt to build a house on Connecticut Avenue, then the action is blocked.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-302-001: Implement Building Rules and Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Building logic correctly validates monopoly ownership and mortgage status. Game state and visuals are updated correctly on successful build.

title: Enforce even building rule for property development
user_role: As a player who owns a complete property set, I want the game to enforce the 'even building' rule when I try to purchase or sell houses, so that the game is fair and follows official Monopoly rules.
dependencies: Given I own a three-property monopoly where Property A has 1 house, and Properties B and C have 0 houses, when I attempt to build a second house on Property A, then the action is blocked, and the UI provides feedback explaining that I must build evenly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly one house, when I attempt to build a second house on any single property in that set, then the transaction is successful, and the selected property now has two houses.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a monopoly where Property A has 3 houses, and Properties B and C each have 2 houses, when I attempt to sell a house from Property B or C, then the action is blocked, and the UI indicates that I must sell from the property with the most houses first (Property A).
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-302-001: Implement Building Rules and Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. 'Even building' and 'even selling' logic is implemented and unit tested. UI provides clear feedback and correctly disables/enables actions based on the rule.

title: Upgrade a set of 4 houses to a single hotel
user_role: As a strategic player who has developed a monopoly with four houses on each property, I want to purchase a hotel for each of those properties, so that I can charge the maximum possible rent.
dependencies: Given I own a monopoly where every property has exactly 4 houses, I have sufficient cash, and the Bank has hotels, when I initiate the 'Build Hotel' action, then my cash is reduced by the hotel cost, the Bank's hotel count decreases by 1, house count increases by 4, and the board visual changes from 4 houses to 1 hotel.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a monopoly where two properties have 4 houses, but a third property has only 3 houses, when I select any property within that monopoly, then the option to build a hotel is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am eligible to build a hotel but the Bank's supply of 12 hotels is exhausted, when I attempt to purchase a hotel, then the transaction is blocked, and a UI notification informs me of the hotel shortage.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-302-001: Implement Building Rules and Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Hotel upgrade logic is implemented and tested. All prerequisites (even building, bank supply, cash) are correctly validated. Game state and visuals are updated atomically.

title: Notify player of building shortage when attempting to build
user_role: As a player
description: I want to receive a clear notification when I am unable to build because the bank has run out of houses or hotels
priority: so that I understand the game state.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the Property Management screen, when I attempt to purchase a house and the bank's supply of houses is 0, then the purchase action is prevented, and a non-modal notification appears with text like 'Cannot build: No houses available in the bank.'
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the bank's supply of houses is 0, when I view my properties in the Property Management interface, then the 'Build House' button(s) for all eligible properties are visually disabled.
technical_tasks: Given the bank's supply of houses was 0 and the build buttons were disabled, when another player sells houses back to the bank, then on my next turn, the 'Build House' buttons in my interface become enabled again.
definition_of_done: WI-302-002: Implement Building Shortage and Auction
column14: All acceptance criteria met. UI provides clear, non-modal feedback for building shortages. Build buttons are dynamically disabled/enabled based on bank supply.

title: Participate in an auction for the last available buildings
user_role: As a strategic player, I want to participate in an auction for the last available houses or hotels when there's a building shortage, so that I have a fair chance to acquire these critical assets.
dependencies: Given the Bank has only 2 houses remaining, and both the Human Player and an AI are eligible to build, when the Human Player confirms their intent to build, then the game identifies the shortage, and a building auction is initiated for the 2 available houses, one at a time.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a building auction is active and it is the Human Player's turn to bid, when the auction UI is presented, then the UI must clearly display the item being auctioned ('1 House'), the current high bid, and allow the player to 'Bid' or 'Pass'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Fast' or 'Instant', when a building auction involving the Human Player is triggered, then the game speed must be temporarily set to 'Normal' for the duration of the auction, reverting after it concludes.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-302-002: Implement Building Shortage and Auction
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Building shortage auction is implemented and tested. UI is clear and functional. AI bidding logic is present. Game speed override is functional.

title: Mortgage an undeveloped property to get cash
user_role: As a player managing my finances, I want to mortgage my undeveloped properties to the Bank, so that I can receive immediate cash to pay debts or fund purchases.
dependencies: Given I am the active player and own an undeveloped and unmortgaged property, when I select the property and confirm the 'Mortgage' action, then my cash balance increases by the property's mortgage value, its state is updated to 'mortgaged', and the board/UI visually reflects this change.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a property with one or more houses on it, when I select the developed property in the Property Management interface, then the 'Mortgage' option is disabled, and a tooltip informs me that all buildings must be sold first.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I own a mortgaged property, when an opponent's token lands on that property space, then no rent transaction occurs.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-301-003: Implement Mortgaging and Unmortgaging
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Mortgaging transaction is implemented correctly. UI validation prevents mortgaging developed properties. Rent collection logic correctly skips mortgaged properties.

title: Unmortgage a property by paying the principal plus 10% interest
user_role: As a Human Player managing my assets, I want to pay the bank to unmortgage one of my properties so that I can start collecting rent on it again and enable future development.
dependencies: Given I own 'St. Charles Place' which is mortgaged (mortgage value $70), when I choose to unmortgage it for $77, and I have sufficient cash, then exactly $77 is deducted from my cash, the property's state is updated to 'unmortgaged', and its visual indicator returns to normal.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I own a mortgaged property and attempt to unmortgage it, but I have insufficient funds to cover the cost (principal + 10% interest), then the 'Unmortgage' button in the UI is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I have successfully unmortgaged 'St. Charles Place', when an opponent later lands on it, then rent is collected from them as normal.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-301-003: Implement Mortgaging and Unmortgaging
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Unmortgage calculation and transaction are correct. UI validation for insufficient funds is working. Rent collection is correctly re-enabled.

title: Initiate a trade with an AI opponent during my turn
user_role: As a human player, I want to open a trading interface and construct a trade offer, so that I can strategically negotiate to acquire properties I need to complete monopolies.
dependencies: Given it is the human player's turn, during the Pre-Roll Management Phase, when the player opens the trade interface, selects an AI opponent, constructs an offer, and clicks 'Propose Trade', then the trade proposal is submitted to the selected AI's decision-making module for evaluation.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the human player owns a property that has one or more houses on it, when the player opens the trade interface, then the developed property is not available for selection in the trade UI, or it is visually disabled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the human player has $500 cash, when the player attempts to enter an amount greater than $500 in the cash offer field, then the UI prevents the input or caps the value at $500, and the 'Propose Trade' button is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-003: Develop Property Management and Trading Interfaces
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Trade initiation and offer construction are fully functional. Business rule validation (no developed properties, sufficient cash) is implemented in the UI.

title: Respond to a trade offer from an AI opponent
user_role: As a human player, I want to be presented with a clear, interactive dialog when an AI opponent proposes a trade, so that I can evaluate the deal and decide to accept or decline it.
dependencies: Given an AI opponent has initiated a trade proposal, when the system presents the offer, then the game flow is paused and a modal dialog is displayed, showing the offered/requested assets and buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer'.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when the human player clicks the 'Accept' button, then the system re-validates the trade, exchanges the assets atomically, closes the dialog, and displays a success notification.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the trade offer dialog is displayed, when the human player clicks the 'Decline' button, then the trade dialog closes immediately, no assets are exchanged, and the game flow resumes.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-003: Develop Property Management and Trading Interfaces
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. AI-initiated trade dialog is implemented. Accept and Decline logic is fully functional and tested. Asset exchange is atomic.

title: Propose a counter-offer to an AI's trade proposal
user_role: As a strategic player negotiating with an AI, I want to respond to their trade proposal with a modified counter-offer, so that I can fine-tune the deal to better suit my strategic goals.
dependencies: Given an AI has proposed a trade, when the player clicks the 'Propose Counter-Offer' button, then the trade proposal dialog closes, and the main two-panel trading UI opens, pre-populated with the AI's original offer.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has opened the counter-offer UI and modified the trade, when the player submits the counter-offer, then the AI's evaluation logic is triggered, the AI responds (accepts or declines), a notification confirms the outcome, and assets are exchanged only if accepted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has opened the counter-offer UI, when the player clicks the 'Cancel' button without submitting a new offer, then the trading UI closes, the original trade offer is considered declined, and the game returns to its prior state.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-003: Develop Property Management and Trading Interfaces
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Counter-offer button correctly transitions to the main trading UI. UI is pre-populated correctly. AI response logic is integrated.

title: Receive a non-intrusive notification when AI players trade with each other
user_role: As a human player, I want to see a non-intrusive notification when a trade is completed between two AI opponents, so that I can maintain situational awareness of the game's strategic landscape.
dependencies: Given a game is in progress with a human player and two AI opponents, when AI 1 successfully completes a trade with AI 2, exchanging 'Boardwalk' for $500, then a notification banner appears on the screen with the text 'Trade Complete: AI 1 traded Boardwalk to AI 2 for $500'.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress, when AI 1 proposes a trade to AI 2, and AI 2 rejects the offer, then no trade notification is displayed to the human player.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has set the 'Game Speed' to 'Instant', when two AI players complete a trade, then the trade notification is still displayed for its full, standard duration.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-401-003: Develop AI Decision Logic Nodes
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Notification system is integrated with the AI trading logic. Notifications are non-intrusive, accurate, and respect game speed settings for visibility.

title: Automatically collect rent when an opponent lands on my property
user_role: As a property owner
description: I want the game to automatically calculate and transfer the correct rent from an opponent who lands on my property so that the game rules are enforced fairly.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given Player A owns 'Baltic Avenue' (but not 'Mediterranean Avenue') and it is not mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Baltic Avenue', then the base rent for 'Baltic Avenue' ($4) is automatically deducted from Player B's cash and added to Player A's cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns 'St. Charles Place', 'States Avenue', and 'Virginia Avenue' (a monopoly), and none have houses or are mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Virginia Avenue', then the rent, which is double the base rent ($20), is automatically transferred from Player B to Player A.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given Player A owns 'Indiana Avenue' and it is currently mortgaged, when Player B lands on 'Indiana Avenue', then no rent is collected, and no cash is transferred between players.
technical_tasks: WI-301-002: Implement Rent Collection Logic
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Rent calculation logic is unit tested for all property types and states (standard, monopoly, developed, railroad, utility, mortgaged). Integration with bankruptcy system is verified.

title: Automatically pay rent when I land on an opponent's property
user_role: As a player, I want the game to automatically calculate and process my rent payment when I land on an opponent's property, so that the game flows smoothly and the rules are enforced correctly.
dependencies: Given I am a player with $1000 cash and an AI owns Illinois Avenue with 3 houses (rent $750), when my token's movement ends on Illinois Avenue, then my cash is automatically reduced to $250 and the AI's cash increases by $750.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI opponent owns both Utilities and my last dice roll was a total of 9, when my token's movement ends on Water Works, then the rent is calculated as 10 times the dice roll (10 * 9 = $90) and deducted from my cash.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am a player with $50 cash and no mortgagable assets, and I land on an opponent's property where the rent is $100, when the rent payment is triggered, then the system identifies I cannot pay the debt and initiates the bankruptcy process.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-301-002: Implement Rent Collection Logic
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Rent payment is automatic and accurate for all property types. Integration with UI for feedback is complete. Bankruptcy trigger is verified.

title: See a victory screen when I am the last player remaining
user_role: As a human player who has won the game, I want to be presented with a distinct and celebratory victory screen, so that my achievement is acknowledged and I feel a sense of accomplishment.
dependencies: Given a game is in progress, when the last AI opponent is declared bankrupt, making the human player the sole remaining participant, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal Victory Screen.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when the player views the screen, then the screen must display a prominent 'Victory!' message, the player's profile name, and key statistics like Final Net Worth and Game Duration.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Victory Screen is displayed, when the screen first appears, then a victory fanfare audio clip plays and celebratory visual effects (e.g., confetti) are rendered.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-303-001: Implement Bankruptcy Detection and Asset Transfer
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Win condition correctly triggers the victory screen. Screen displays accurate stats and celebratory effects. Navigation to other screens is functional.

title: See a game-over screen when I go bankrupt
user_role: As a human player, I want to be shown a clear 'Game Over' screen immediately after I am declared bankrupt, so that I understand I have lost the game.
dependencies: Given the human player incurs a debt they cannot pay after liquidating all assets, when the system declares the player bankrupt, then the main game view is immediately replaced by a modal 'Game Over' screen.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the 'Game Over' screen is displayed, when the player views the screen, then it must contain a prominent header text like 'Game Over' and a single button labeled 'View Game Summary'.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the human player is viewing the 'Game Over' screen and more than one AI opponent remains, when the player clicks the 'View Game Summary' button, then a high-speed simulation of the remaining AI players' turns begins until a single AI winner is determined.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-303-001: Implement Bankruptcy Detection and Asset Transfer
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Loss condition correctly triggers the game over screen. The screen contains the correct UI elements. The subsequent high-speed AI simulation is functional.

title: View a detailed game summary screen after a match ends
user_role: As a Human Player who has just completed a game, I want to be shown a detailed game summary screen so that I can review the performance of all players and understand the final outcome.
dependencies: Given a game has concluded with a human victory, when the Game Summary screen is displayed, then a 'Victory!' message is prominently displayed, the human player is highlighted as the winner, and statistics are shown for all players.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game has concluded with a human loss, when the Game Summary screen is displayed, then a 'Game Over' message is displayed, the final winning AI player is highlighted as the winner, and statistics for all players are displayed.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the Game Summary screen is displayed, when the user clicks the 'Return to Main Menu' button, then the application navigates to the main menu screen.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-303-001: Implement Bankruptcy Detection and Asset Transfer
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Summary screen displays correct information for both win and loss scenarios. Statistics shown are accurate. Navigation is functional.

title: View at-a-glance information for all players in the HUD
user_role: As a player, I want a persistent on-screen display showing the name, token, and current cash for every player, so that I can instantly assess the financial standing of my opponents and myself.
dependencies: Given a new 4-player game has started, when the main game board scene is loaded, then a persistent Heads-Up Display (HUD) is visible, with four panels each correctly displaying a player's name, token icon, and starting cash of $1500.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a game is in progress and it is Player 1's turn, when the player views the game screen, then Player 1's panel in the HUD has a distinct visual highlight (e.g., a glowing border).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has a cash balance of $1000 displayed in the HUD, when the player passes GO and collects a $200 salary, then the player's cash display in the HUD immediately updates to show $1200.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-002: Implement In-Game HUD
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. HUD displays correct information for all players. Turn indicator and cash values update in real-time. Layout is responsive.

title: See clear visual indicators of property ownership on the board
user_role: As a player, I want clear, player-specific visual indicators on each property space on the board so that I can instantly understand who owns what and make faster strategic decisions.
dependencies: Given a property on the board is unowned, when a player successfully purchases that property, then a visual indicator corresponding to the purchasing player's unique color/token immediately appears on the property space.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player owns a property and its standard ownership indicator is displayed, when the player mortgages that property, then the ownership indicator's visual state changes to clearly signify it is mortgaged (e.g., becomes greyed-out or semi-transparent).
acceptance_criteria_2: Given Player A owns Property X and Player B owns Property Y, when they complete a trade exchanging ownership, then the marker on Property X immediately updates to show Player B's ownership, and the marker on Property Y updates to show Player A's ownership.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-501-001: Implement 3D Game Board and Camera
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Ownership markers are implemented and correctly reflect the game state after all trigger events (purchase, mortgage, trade, bankruptcy). Indicators are theme-aware.

title: Interact with modal dialogs for critical decisions
user_role: As a human player, I want the game to pause and display a focused, interactive pop-up for critical, turn-halting decisions, so that I can consciously evaluate my options and make informed choices.
dependencies: Given I am the human player and I land on an unowned property, when my turn is active, then the game's background processes are paused and a modal dialog is displayed showing the property's details and 'Buy'/'Auction' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given an AI opponent has proposed a trade, when the trade offer is presented to me, then the game pauses and a modal dialog displays the trade details with 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Counter-Offer' buttons.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given any critical decision modal dialog is active on screen, when I attempt to click on any UI element outside of the modal dialog, then the clicks are ignored, and only interactions with the elements inside the modal dialog are registered.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-003: Develop Property Management and Trading Interfaces
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. A reusable modal dialog system is created and integrated for property purchase, trade response, and tax decisions. Modals correctly pause game flow and block background interaction.

title: Access a dedicated interface to manage all my properties
user_role: As a human player, I want to access a dedicated property management screen so that I can efficiently view my properties and take strategic actions like building or mortgaging from a single interface.
dependencies: Given it is the human player's turn, before they have rolled the dice, when the player clicks the 'Manage Properties' button in the main HUD, then a dedicated property management screen is displayed, overlaying the main game board.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has a complete, undeveloped monopoly and sufficient cash, when the player selects a property from that monopoly and clicks the 'Build House' button, then the player's cash is debited by the correct building cost and the UI updates immediately.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player owns a monopoly where one property has 1 house and the others have 0, when the player selects the property that already has 1 house, then the 'Build House' button for that property is disabled, and an informative tooltip explains that building must be even.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-003: Develop Property Management and Trading Interfaces
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. The property management UI is fully implemented and accessible at the correct time. All actions (build, sell, mortgage, unmortgage) are available and their UI state is correctly managed by game rules (monopoly required, even building, etc.).

title: Use a two-panel interface to build and review trade offers
user_role: As a Human Player, I want a clear, two-panel trading interface that displays my items and the opponent's items side-by-side so that I can easily construct, review, and understand trade offers.
dependencies: Given the trading interface is open, when the player adds one of their properties and enters a cash amount to the 'Your Offer' panel, and adds one of the AI's properties to the 'Their Offer' panel, then all selected items appear correctly in their respective panels.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the trading interface is open, and the player owns a property with at least one house, when the player attempts to select the developed property to add to their offer, then the property is visually disabled in the selection list and cannot be added to the offer.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given an AI opponent initiates a trade, when the trade offer is presented, then the same two-panel interface appears, pre-populated with the AI's offer, and buttons for 'Accept', 'Decline', and 'Propose Counter-Offer' are displayed.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-003: Develop Property Management and Trading Interfaces
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. The two-panel trading UI is fully functional for player-initiated trades, AI-initiated trades, and counter-offers. All business rule validations are implemented.

title: Access an in-game settings menu
user_role: As a player in the middle of a game
description: I want to access a settings menu without quitting the match
priority: so that I can adjust game options
dependencies: or exit the game.
acceptance_criteria_1: Must Have
technical_tasks: Given a game is in progress and it is the human player's turn, when the player presses the 'Escape' key, then the game simulation is paused and a settings menu is displayed as an overlay.
definition_of_done: Given the in-game settings menu is open, when the player views the menu, then the menu must contain distinct, clickable options for 'Resume Game', 'Settings', 'Save Game', 'Load Game', 'Return to Main Menu', and 'Quit to Desktop'.
column14: Given a game is in progress and an AI opponent is taking its turn, when the human player opens the settings menu, then the AI's turn is paused, and when the player resumes the game, the AI's turn continues from the exact point it was interrupted.
column16: All acceptance criteria met. The in-game pause/settings menu is implemented and functional. It correctly pauses and resumes the game state for both human and AI turns.

title: Adjust the game speed to make animations faster or instant
user_role: As an experienced player, I want to change the game speed setting so that I can reduce waiting times for animations and AI decisions, allowing for a faster-paced game.
dependencies: Given the player is in a game and the game speed is set to 'Normal', when the player navigates to the settings menu and selects the 'Instant' game speed option, then all subsequent game animations are skipped or rendered almost instantaneously, and AI decisions are processed with no artificial delay.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the game speed is set to 'Fast' or 'Instant' and the human player is involved in a property auction, when the auction begins, then the game speed is automatically and temporarily set to 'Normal' for the entire duration of the auction.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a player has set the game speed to 'Fast', when the player saves the game, exits, and then loads that saved game, then the game speed setting is correctly restored to 'Fast'.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-004: Implement Settings Menu
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Game speed setting is implemented and affects all relevant animations and delays. The auction override logic is functional. The setting is correctly persisted in save games.

title: Adjust master, music, and sound effect volumes independently
user_role: As a player, I want to independently adjust the master, music, and sound effect volume levels so that I can customize the game's audio to my personal preference.
dependencies: Given the player is in the settings menu and background music is playing, when the player moves the 'Music' volume slider, then the volume of the background music changes in real-time to match the slider's value, and the new setting is immediately persisted.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in the settings menu, when the player moves the 'Sound Effects' volume slider, then a sample sound effect is played at the new volume level, and the new setting is immediately persisted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has set the Music volume to 30%, when the player closes the game completely and then relaunches it, then the game's audio levels for music are at 30% and the sliders in the settings menu reflect this saved value.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-004: Implement Settings Menu
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Three volume sliders are implemented and functional. Changes provide real-time audio feedback. Settings are correctly saved and loaded between sessions.

title: Reset all my historical statistics and high scores
user_role: As a Data-Conscious Player, I want an option in the settings menu to permanently delete all my historical gameplay statistics and high scores, so that I can have a clean slate.
dependencies: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I navigate to the settings menu, click the 'Reset All Player Data' button, and click 'Confirm' on the subsequent confirmation dialog, then all my historical player statistics are reset to their default zero state in the database.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I have existing historical statistics, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button and then click 'Cancel' on the confirmation dialog, then no data is modified or deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am in the settings menu, when I click the 'Reset All Player Data' button, then a modal confirmation dialog appears with text that explicitly states the action is permanent and cannot be undone.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-004: Implement Settings Menu
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Reset button, confirmation dialog, and success notification are implemented. Database transaction is atomic and correctly removes data for the active profile.

title: Provide a bulk deletion option for all saved games via the settings menu
user_role: As a user, I want an option in the settings menu to delete all my saved games at once, so that I can easily clear out old progress without having to manually find and delete files.
dependencies: Given the user has at least one saved game file, when the user clicks the 'Delete All Saved Games' button AND clicks 'Confirm' on the subsequent confirmation dialog, then all files within the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory are permanently deleted.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user has opened the deletion confirmation dialog, when the user clicks the 'Cancel' button, then the confirmation dialog closes AND no files are deleted.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the user has no saved game files, when the user navigates to the settings menu, then the 'Delete All Saved Games' button is visibly disabled and cannot be clicked.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-502-004: Implement Settings Menu
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Delete button, confirmation dialog, and success notification are implemented. File system operation is robust and correctly scoped. Button state is managed correctly.

title: Start an optional interactive tutorial to learn the game
user_role: As a new player, I want to start an optional, interactive tutorial so that I can learn the basic rules and game controls in a guided, hands-on environment.
dependencies: Given the user is on the main menu, when the user clicks the 'Tutorial' button, then the game transitions to a dedicated, scripted tutorial game state.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the tutorial has started, when the tutorial prompts the player to roll the dice by highlighting the 'Roll' button, then all other UI elements are non-interactive, and the dice animate a pre-determined roll result after being clicked.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has completed the final guided action in the tutorial script, when the final action is confirmed, then a 'Tutorial Complete' modal dialog is displayed with options to 'Start New Game' and 'Return to Main Menu'.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-802-001: Implement Digital Rulebook
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Tutorial is accessible from main menu and guides the user through key mechanics. Scripted events and UI highlighting are functional. Early exit and completion flows work correctly.

title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: Access and search a digital rulebook from game menus
description: As a player, I want to open a searchable digital rulebook from both the main menu and the in-game pause menu so that I can quickly find and clarify specific game rules.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a player is in an active game, when the player opens the pause menu and clicks the 'Rulebook' button, then the rulebook UI is displayed as a modal overlay, and the full list of rules is visible and scrollable.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the rulebook UI is open, when the player types a keyword (e.g., 'mortgage') into the search bar, then the list of rules is dynamically filtered to show only the sections and entries containing the keyword 'mortgage', and the keyword is visually highlighted.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the rulebook's source JSON file is missing or malformed, when the player attempts to open the rulebook, then a user-friendly error message is displayed ('Rulebook data could not be loaded.'), and an ERROR is written to the log file.
technical_tasks: WI-802-001: Implement Digital Rulebook
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Rulebook is accessible from both menus. Search functionality is implemented and performant. Content is loaded from an external JSON file with graceful error handling.

title: Save game progress into one of several save slots
user_role: As a player, I want to save my current game progress into a specific save slot at the start of my turn, so that I can safely exit the game and resume playing from that point at a later time.
dependencies: Given I am in an active game and it is the start of my turn (before rolling), when I open the pause menu, select 'Save Game', and click on an 'Empty' save slot, then the current GameState object is serialized into a versioned JSON file with a checksum in the '%APPDATA%/MonopolyTycoon/saves' directory.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am in the 'Save Game' menu and I click on a slot that contains a previously saved game, when a confirmation dialog appears and I select 'Yes', then the existing save file for that slot is replaced with the new game state data.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given it is an AI player's turn OR it is my turn but after I have rolled the dice, when I open the pause menu, then the 'Save Game' button is visually disabled and is not clickable.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-601-001: Implement GameState Serialization to JSON
