technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Save functionality is implemented and restricted to the correct turn phase. Overwriting saves requires confirmation. Save files are versioned and include a checksum.

title: Load a game from a previously saved slot
user_role: As a returning player, I want to select and load a previously saved game from the main menu, so that I can seamlessly continue my progress without having to start over.
dependencies: Given I am on the main menu and have at least one valid saved game file, when I navigate to the 'Load Game' screen, select the valid save slot, and confirm, then the system deserializes the game state, transitions to the gameplay scene, and the entire game state is perfectly restored.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen, when the list of save slots is displayed, then each occupied and valid slot must display the player's profile name, the date and time of the save, and the turn number.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given I am on the 'Load Game' screen and at least one save file has failed its checksum validation, when the list of save slots is displayed, then the slot corresponding to the corrupted file is visually marked as 'Corrupted' or 'Unusable' and is disabled.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-601-002: Implement GameState Deserialization from JSON
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Game loading restores the state perfectly. Load screen displays correct metadata. Corrupted and incompatible files are handled gracefully.

title: Visually indicate unusable save files on the load game screen
user_role: As a Returning Player, I want to see a clear, visual indication on the load game screen for any save files that are corrupted or incompatible, so that I can understand which games I can no longer play.
dependencies: Given a save file exists whose content does not match its stored checksum, when the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that save slot is visually distinct and clearly labeled as 'Corrupted'.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a save slot is marked as 'Corrupted', when the player attempts to interact with it, then the 'Load' button for that slot is disabled, preventing any load attempt.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given a valid save file exists that was created with an older, incompatible version of the game, when the player navigates to the 'Load Game' screen, then the entry for that save slot is visually distinct and clearly labeled as 'Incompatible Version'.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-601-002: Implement GameState Deserialization from JSON
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Checksum validation and version checking logic are implemented. The Load Game UI correctly displays 'Corrupted' and 'Incompatible' states and disables interaction.

title: View a list of my top 10 victories
user_role: As a competitive player, I want to access a Top 10 High Score screen from the main menu, so that I can review my most successful victories and be motivated to beat my own records.
dependencies: Given the player has won 10 or more games, when the player selects the 'Top Scores' option from the main menu, then a screen is displayed showing a list of exactly 10 entries, sorted by Final Net Worth (descending), each displaying Rank, Name, Net Worth, Duration, and Turns.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player has won 4 games, when the player navigates to the 'Top Scores' screen, then the list displays exactly 4 entries, sorted correctly.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the database contains two victory records with the exact same Final Net Worth, but Victory A was achieved in fewer turns than Victory B, when the player views the 'Top Scores' screen, then Victory A is ranked higher than Victory B.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-602-002: Implement Statistics Repository
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Top Scores screen UI is implemented. Database query correctly fetches and sorts the top 10 scores with tie-breaking rules. Empty and partial list states are handled gracefully.

title: Export my top score history to a text file
user_role: As a competitive player, I want to export my Top 10 High Scores list to a simple, human-readable text file, so that I can easily share my achievements.
dependencies: Given the player is on the 'Top Score History' screen with scores listed, when the player clicks the 'Export to Text' button and confirms the save in the native Windows 'Save As' dialog, then a '.txt' file is created at the specified location.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given a high score file has been successfully exported, when the user opens the exported '.txt' file, then the file contains a clear header, and each score entry is on a new line with all data fields (Rank, Name, Net Worth, etc.) clearly labeled.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the high score list is empty, when the player views the 'Top Score History' screen, then the 'Export to Text' button is visibly disabled and not clickable.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-602-002: Implement Statistics Repository
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Export button is implemented and functional. The native save dialog is invoked. The output .txt file is formatted correctly. Disabled state for empty list works.

title: Change the game's visual and audio theme
user_role: As a player, I want to select and apply different visual and audio themes for the game, so that I can customize my experience and keep the game feeling fresh.
dependencies: Given the player is on the main menu, when the player navigates to the Settings menu, selects the 'Futuristic' theme, and confirms, then the main menu's UI skin, background visuals, and background music immediately change to the 'Futuristic' theme assets.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the player is in an active game with the 'Classic' theme, when the player opens the pause menu, selects the 'Futuristic' theme, and resumes the game, then all in-game assets (game board, tokens, UI/HUD, music, SFX) are updated to the 'Futuristic' theme.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the player has previously selected the 'Futuristic' theme and closed the application, when the player launches the game again, then the game starts up with the 'Futuristic' theme already active.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-501-001: Implement 3D Game Board and Camera
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Theming system for dynamic asset swapping is implemented. At least two complete themes are created and fully functional. Theme selection persists between sessions.

title: Be notified of available game updates on startup
user_role: As a Game Player, I want to be notified in a non-intrusive way when a new version of the game is available upon startup, so that I can easily access the latest features and bug fixes.
dependencies: Given I have an older version of the game installed and an active internet connection, when I launch the application, then the game performs a version check asynchronously, and a non-intrusive notification is displayed on the main menu indicating an update is available with a clickable link to the download page.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given I do not have an active internet connection, when I launch the application, then the version check fails silently in the background, no error message is displayed, and the game loads to the main menu normally.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the update notification is displayed on the main menu, when I ignore the notification and proceed to start a new game, then I can interact with all main menu options as normal, and the notification does not block any functionality.
acceptance_criteria_3: WI-101-001: Initialize Unity Project and Git Repository
technical_tasks: All acceptance criteria met. Asynchronous version check is implemented on startup. Success, no-update, and failure (no network) paths are handled gracefully. Notification is non-intrusive.

title: Packaging & Distribution
user_role: View the game's data privacy statement
description: As a privacy-conscious user, I want to access and read a clear data privacy statement from the main menu, so that I can understand what data the game collects and confirm that it operates entirely offline.
acceptance_criteria_1: Given the user is on the main menu screen, when the user clicks the 'Privacy Policy' button, then a modal view appears, displaying the game's data privacy statement.
acceptance_criteria_2: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user reads the content, then the text must explicitly confirm that the application operates entirely offline, all user-generated data is stored locally, and no data is transmitted to any external server.
acceptance_criteria_3: Given the privacy statement view is open, when the user clicks the 'Close' or 'Back' button, then the privacy statement view is dismissed, and the main menu becomes interactive again.
technical_tasks: WI-802-002: Implement Data Privacy Statement
definition_of_done: All acceptance criteria met. Privacy policy screen is accessible from the main menu. Content is loaded from a resource file and accurately reflects the game's offline nature. UI is functional and approved.
